# Notation {-}

A summary of notation used in these notes.


"$A \implies B$" is read as "statement $A$ implies statement $B$".


We often use Greek letters for mathematical symbols.

| Capital letter | Small letter | Name |
|---|---|---|
| $A$ | $\alpha$ | Alpha |
| $B$ | $\beta$ | Beta |
| $\Gamma$ | $\gamma$ | Gamma |
| $\Delta$ | $\delta$ | Delta |
| $E$ | $\epsilon$, $\varepsilon$ | Epsilon |
| $Z$ | $\zeta$ | Zeta |
| $H$ | $\eta$ | Eta |
| $\Theta$ | $\theta$, $\vartheta$ | Theta |
| $I$ | $\iota$ | Iota |
| $K$ | $\kappa$ | Kappa |
| $\Lambda$ | $\lambda$ | Lambda |
| $M$ | $\mu$ | Mu |
| $N$ | $\nu$ | Nu |
| $\Xi$ | $\xi$ | Xi |
| $O$ | $\omicron$ | Omicron |
| $\Pi$ | $\pi$ | Pi |
| $R$ | $\rho$, $\varrho$ | Rho |
| $\Sigma$ | $\sigma$ | Sigma |
| $T$ | $\tau$ | Tau |
| $\Upsilon$ | $\upsilon$ | Upsilon |
| $\Phi$ | $\phi$, $\varphi$ | Phi |
| $X$ | $\chi$ | Chi |
| $\Psi$ | $\psi$ | Psi |
| $\Omega$ | $\omega$ | Omega |
